parties.raw_snippet: TRANSFER AND SERVICING AGREEMENT, dated as of January 29, 2020 (this “Agreement”), among VERIZON OWNER TRUST 2020-A, a Delaware statutory trust, as issuer (the “Issuer”), VERIZON ABS LLC, a Delaware limited liability company, as depositor (the “Depositor”), and Cellco Partnership d/b/a Verizon Wireless, a Delaware general partnership (“Cellco”), as servicer (in such capacity, the “Servicer”), as marketing agent (in such capacity, the “Marketing Agent”) and as custodian (in such capacity, the “Custodian”).
parties.reasoning: This paragraph expressly identifies the contracting parties, their legal forms and the capacities in which they act. It appears in the introductory recitals and names the Issuer, the Depositor and Cellco (the Servicer/Marketing Agent/Custodian).

contract_type.raw_snippet: The Issuer will engage the Servicer to service the Receivables.
contract_type.reasoning: Although the document title is 'Transfer and Servicing Agreement', the core economic substance is that the Issuer acquires pools of receivables and engages Cellco to service those receivables (collection, administration, reporting, etc.). That makes this primarily a services arrangement (servicing of receivables).

notice_period.reasoning: I searched for any clause that creates an automatic renewal and an advance notice requirement to prevent renewal. The agreement contains termination, resignation and replacement provisions, and termination on final payment, but it does not contain language describing an automatic renewal term requiring advance notice to prevent renewal. Therefore there is no "notice period to prevent automatic renewal" to extract.

expiration_date.raw_snippet: This Agreement will terminate on the earlier to occur of (a) the date upon which the last remaining Receivable is paid in full, settled, sold or written off and any amounts received are applied and (b) the Issuer is terminated under Section 8.1 of the Trust Agreement.
expiration_date.reasoning: Section 8.3 explicitly states when the Agreement terminates — it is tied to the final payment/settlement/write-off of the last Receivable or termination of the Issuer under the Trust Agreement. This is a relative/contingent termination provision rather than a fixed calendar date.
expiration_date.normalized_value: the earlier to occur of (a) the date upon which the last remaining Receivable is paid in full, settled, sold or written off and any amounts received are applied and (b) the Issuer is terminated under Section 8.1 of the Trust Agreement

renewal_term.reasoning: No automatic renewal or renewal-term clause was found. The agreement contemplates termination upon certain events (e.g., final payment of Receivables, servicer resignation/termination), but does not provide for renewal terms or automatic extension periods.
